PageTitle: subnet length initial (Global CGN address pool view)
FuncDef:
The subnet length initial command sets the lengths and masks of the initial and extended address segments for a global dynamic address pool.
The undo subnet length initial command deletes the lengths and masks of the initial and extended address segments for a global dynamic address pool.
By default, the lengths and masks of the initial and extended address segments are not set for a global dynamic address pool.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the mask length of the initial address segments in a global address pool.
The value can be 0 or an integer ranging from 16 to 32 in PAT mode. The value can be 0 or an integer ranging from 16 to 27 in NoPAT mode. If the value is set to 0, the mask length of an address segment is delivered by a RADIUS server.

Specifies the mask of the initial address segments in a global address pool.
The value is in dotted decimal notation, for example, 255.255.0.0.

Specifies the mask length of the extended address segments in a global address pool.
The value can be 0 or an integer ranging from 16 to 32 in PAT mode. The value can be 0 or an integer ranging from 16 to 27 in NoPAT mode. If the value is set to 0, the mask length of an address segment is delivered by a RADIUS server.

Specifies the mask of the extended address segments in a global address pool.
The value is in dotted decimal notation, for example, 255.255.0.0.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the lengths and masks of the initial and extended address segments for a global dynamic address pool, run the subnet length initial command.
Configuration Impact
Once the subnet length initial command is run, a request is sent to apply for an address segment. If a dynamic address pool contains address segments, the mask length of the address segments cannot be modified.
If extend parameters are not configured, the mask or mask length of the extended address segment is equal to the mask or mask length of the initial address segment.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
